IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THE LEXINGTON MONTESSORI SCHOOL COMMUNITY WORKS TO CREATE AN ENVIRONMENT THAT INSPIRES CHILDREN TO DEVELOP INNER DISCIPLINE, SELF-ASSURANCE, AND A LOVE OF LEARNING. WE RESPECT THE UNIQUENESS OF EACH STUDENT BY HELPING EACH CHILD TO DEVELOP SKILLS AT PERIODS OF GREATEST READINESS AND SENSITIVITY.OUR PROGRAM PROVIDES A CREATIVE AND ADAPTIVE ENVIRONMENT THAT RESPONDS TO THE NEEDS OF THE CHILDREN. WE SEEK TO BALANCE ACADEMIC AND SOCIAL DEVELOPMENT TO FOSTER RESPONSIBILITY AND COOPERATION WITHIN A SUPPORTIVE LEARNING COMMUNITY.OUR STUDENTS LEARN TO VIEW THEMSELVES AS CONTRIBUTING MEMBERS OF A DIVERSE GLOBAL COMMUNITY. WE RESPECT AND VALUE DIFFERENCES, AND LOOK WITH AN OPEN MIND AT ALL MEMBERS OF THE COMMUNITY, SEEKING TO UNDERSTAND AND VALUE THEM FOR WHO THEY ARE. THE STAFF, THE PARENTS AND THE CHILDREN COMMUNICATE CLEARLY AND OPENLY AND TREAT EACH OTHER WITH HONESTY AND MUTUAL RESPECT.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE LEXINGTON MONTESSORI SCHOOL COMMUNITY WORKS TO CREATE AN ENVIRONMENT THAT INSPIRES CHILDREN TO DEVELOP INNER DISCIPLINE, SELF-ASSURANCE, AND A LOVE OF LEARNING. WE RESPECT THE UNIQUENESS OF EACH STUDENT BY HELPING EACH CHILD TO DEVELOP SKILLS AT PERIODS OF GREATEST READINESS AND SENSITIVITY.OUR PROGRAM PROVIDES A CREATIVE AND ADAPTIVE ENVIRONMENT THAT RESPONDS TO THE NEEDS OF THE CHILDREN. WE SEEK TO BALANCE ACADEMIC AND SOCIAL DEVELOPMENT TO FOSTER RESPONSIBILITY AND COOPERATION WITHIN A SUPPORTIVE LEARNING COMMUNITY.OUR STUDENTS LEARN TO VIEW THEMSELVES AS CONTRIBUTING MEMBERS OF A DIVERSE GLOBAL COMMUNITY. WE RESPECT AND VALUE DIFFERENCES, AND LOOK WITH AN OPEN MIND AT ALL MEMBERS OF THE COMMUNITY, SEEKING TO UNDERSTAND AND VALUE THEM FOR WHO THEY ARE. THE STAFF, THE PARENTS AND THE CHILDREN COMMUNICATE CLEARLY AND OPENLY AND TREAT EACH OTHER WITH HONESTY AND MUTUAL RESPECT.
IRS990.Desc: PROVIDING INDEPENDENT EDUCATIONAL SERVICES ON A NONDISCRIMINATORY BASIS TO 227 STUDENTS FROM PRESCHOOL TO GRADE EIGHT USING THE MONTESSORI METHOD.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SCHOOL BELONGS TO MEMBER ORGANIZATIONS, WHICH MAY ENGAGE IN LOBBYING ACTIVITIES. SOME PORTION OF MEMBERSHIP DUES MAY BE UTILIZED FOR LOBBYING ACTIVITIES.
THE SCHOOL'S ENDOWMENT FUNDS ARE BEING HELD FOR THEIR INTENDED PURPOSES INCLUDING TEACHER DEVELOPMENT AND MONTESSORI EDUCATION, DIVERSITY, AND ALLOWING UNDERPRIVILEGED CHILDREN TO ATTEND THE SCHOOL.

ALL PARENTS OF ENROLLED STUDENTS RECEIVE THE SCHOOL HANDBOOK WHICH STATES THE "NONDISCRIMINATORY POLICY" OF THE LEXINGTON MONTESSORI SCHOOL, INC. THE SCHOOL POLICY IS ALSO PUBLISHED ANNUALLY IN LOCAL NEWSPAPERS.

GrantsOtherAsstToIndivInUSGrp.GrantTypeTxt: FINANCIAL AID AWARDS TO STUDENTS ATTENDING LEXINGTON MONTESSORI SCHOOL.
GrantsOtherAsstToIndivInUSGrp.ValuationMethodUsedDesc: FMV BASED ON CURRENT TUITION RATES
GrantsOtherAsstToIndivInUSGrp.NonCashAssistanceDesc: FINANCIAL AID AT LMS IS NEED-BASED. OUR GOAL IS TO OFFER AN LMS EDUCATION TO CHILDREN WHO REPRESENT A BROAD SOCIO-ECONOMIC SPECTRUM. WE BELIEVE IN MAINTAINING A FINANCIAL AID PROGRAM THAT AVOIDS A FINANCIALLY POLARIZED COMMUNITY. TO THAT END, WE OFFER PARTIAL AID AND MONITOR THE DISTRIBUTION OF AID TO MAKE SURE WE CONTINUE TO INCLUDE LOWER- AND MIDDLE-INCOME FAMILIES IN OUR AID PROGRAM.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FINANCIAL AID / SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED ON A NONDISCRIMINATORY BASIS. DISCLOSURE WOULD VIOLATE FAMILY PRIVACY ACT.

IssuerName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: 2006 MASSACHUSETTS DEVELOPMENT FINANCE AGENCY 545 TAX EXEMPT BONDS

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A COPY OF THE 990 IS PROVIDED TO THE FINANCE AND AUDIT COMMITTEES OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS AS WELL AS THE FULL BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND IS THOROUGHLY REVIEWED BEFORE IT IS FILED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: UPON ELECTION TO THE BOARD, AND ANNUALLY THEREAFTER DURING HIS OR HER TERM, EACH DIRECTOR COMPLETES A CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY STATEMENT. EACH COMPLETED STATEMENT IS REVIEWED AND RETAINED BY THE PRESIDENT AND SECRETARY OF THE BOARD TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH THIS POLICY'S RESTRAINTS ON PARTICIPATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD EVALUATES THE PERFORMANCE OF THE HEAD OF SCHOOL ANNUALLY DURING THE SPRING OF EACH YEAR. THE PROCESS INCLUDES A WRITTEN REPORT DESCRIBING THE BOARD'S EVALUATION, WHICH IS THEN GIVEN TO THE HEAD OF SCHOOL. THE ANNUAL PERCENTAGE INCREASE IN SALARY AWARDED WILL NOT BE LESS THAN THE PERCENTAGE INCREASE IN SALARY AWARDED TO STAFF IN SUCH YEAR.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 18
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S TAX FILINGS ARE AVAILABLE ONLINE FOR VIEWING AT THE MASSACHUSETTS ATTORNEY GENERAL'S DIVISION OF PUBLIC CHARITIES WEBSITE AS WELL AS AT WWW.GUIDESTAR.ORG, A WEBSITE USED TO RATE NON-PROFITS FOR POTENTIAL DONORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE ONLINE FOR VIEWING AT THE MASSACHUSETTS ATTORNEY GENERAL'S DIVISION OF PUBLIC CHARITIES WEBSITE AS WELL AS AT WWW.GUIDESTAR.ORG, A WEBSITE USED TO RATE NON-PROFITS FOR POTENTIAL DONORS.
